page.title: 08Royston Drift Mine
page.content: Royston Drift mine is a medium sized pit. Mining is one of the largest industries in the area and the mine at Royston has been an important part of our village since it was first started as Monckton Main Colliery in 1875. There are 500 workers at the pit.420 people work underground and 80 people work above ground. 50% of the workers come from the local villages of Royston and Ryhill. The pit produces half a million tonnes of coal a year for the power stations of Ferrybridge and Eggborough.The coal is taken on trains There are two trains a day.Each train carries 1000 tonnes of coal. The Drift Mine is 100m deep and it goes 3 to 4km underground.Mining is still a dangerous job.Colin Gwynne our next door neighbour is a miner.
